Comments_List: I developed the ability to set out a schedule for learning a topic independently, which is very useful as it's the modus operandi in Grad School. The relationship one has with a professor is also quite different when a lot less structure is involved and you have to take up the work of selecting materials, and evaluating how long things take. In terms of topic, I learned a lot about the structures of neural networks, and its different applications.
It is only for mature students. There's absolutely no hand-holding, and any progress you make is due to your own self-motivation.
Only if you're mature enough to realize that you'll be learning about a topic on your own for the most part. I'd really recommend it for Graduate School.
